page.title: 11ANCIENT HOUSES
page.content: There are two ancient houses in the Three Mosses area. Both are privately owned. 1. Stocks Cottage in Haskayne village is reputedly the oldest house in the West Lancs. district. Dating back to approx. 12th Century, and exceptionally good example of the Crook Beam structure. The cottage was extensively renovated several years ago. 2. Leigh's Cottages in Station Road, Barton dates back to the early 18th Century. Built on stable ground, the rounded tower frontage with window was reputedly used as a guide for ships when a light was placed there. The house was dedicated to the Rev. Canon Leigh who rode on horseback to Walton-on-the-Hill to give the services. The house is privately owned.
